title: 148863559.too Good To Be True
excerpt: It's a curious irony that things that market themselves as ‘to be too good to be true’ often aren't true. And things that aren't obviously so, often are.

children.text: It's a curious irony that things that market themselves as ‘to be too good to be true’ often aren't true. And things that aren't obviously so, often are.
Consider, for example, the perfect anything--the perfect job, the perfect car, the perfect vacation or television or mattress.
